file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-21-03-06 - OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to inspect/check the optional flight attendant seat. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - ALL 25-21-03-200-801-A ♦ INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-21-03 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-21-03-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSPECTION A. General (1) The function of this inspection is to make sure that the optional flight attendant seat operate correctly. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) To do the detailed inspection of the optional flight attendant seat, have a direct source of good lighting to make the lighting conditions in the cabin better. I. Inspect (Detailed Inspection) Optional Flight Attendant Seat harness, Inertial Reel for Condition and the Seat Bottom for Freedom of Movement and Returning Back to Upright Position SUBTASK 220-002-A (1) Do a detailed inspection of the optional flight attendant seat, as follows: (a) Do a folding-out sequence operational check as follows (Figure 601): 1 Move the control handle rearward and move the optional flight attendant seat assembly to your right side until it stops. 2 Move the seat bottom and back assembly forward and down until it locks. 3 Turn down the control handle and move the seat back rearward until it locks (in-use position). (b) Do an inspection of the optional flight attendant seat assembly as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 25-21-03 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 1 Examine the seat harness for general conditions, easily seen degradation, damage and failure. 2 Examine the harness adjustments. 3 Close and open the seat belt buckle two or three times to make sure that it operates correctly. 4 Make sure that the harness assembly extends and retracts freely. Also make sure that the seat belts lock when you suddenly pull them. (c) Do a folding-in sequence operational check as follows (Figure 602): 1 Move the control handle forwards and move the seat back forward and down until it locks. 2 Lift the control handle and move the seat bottom and back assembly rearward. 3 Move the optional flight attendant seat assembly to your left side until it latches correctly (stowed position). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 25-21-03 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
